fields.fieldText:
ANNUAL ONGOING MONITORING

& ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHECKLIST

fields.name: client_face
fields.fieldText:
Have we met the client face to face?

 

 If yes who? 

 

If “No” the client must be treated as high risk

fields.name: Names
fields.fieldText: Names

fields.name: PEP
fields.fieldText: Has the client or a member of their family or a known close associate become a Politically Exposed Person (PEP)?

fields.name: EDD
fields.fieldText:
If “Yes” the client must be treated as high risk and Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) procedures as set out in the firm’s Client Acceptance Guidance Notes (available on the intranet) applied. Record EDD procedures undertaken here:

Does the client hold assets or undertake activities overseas?

fields.name: Risk
fields.fieldText: Considering the above factors, the Money Laundering Risk is:

fields.name: Copy_1_of_anonymity
fields.fieldText: ANTI-MONEY LAUNDERING REVIEW

fields.name: d
fields.fieldText: d

fields.name: risk_level
fields.fieldText: Has the risk level changed from Normal to High since the previously recorded risk level?

fields.name: e
fields.fieldText: e

fields.name: NB
fields.fieldText:
If “Yes” detail the additional verification work carried out:


NB: Identity verification

 

Normal Risk:  SmartSearch check (“Normal” risk setting) OR one government issued document with photo e.g. passport or driving licence;

 

High Risk:       SmartSearch check (“High” risk setting);

OR

One government issued document with photo e.g. passport or driving licence AND document detailing address e.g. utility bill.

fields.fieldText: Ensure that the “know your client” information held on our files for anti-money laundering purposes is updated for any changes identified above and in any other relevant respects. Embed copies of the forms listed below. If not held indicate ‘Not found/held’

New Client Form or

Client Acceptance  Form

fields.fieldText: Engagement Letter

fields.name: g
fields.fieldText: g

fields.name: Engagement_Letter_cover
fields.fieldText: Does the current Engagement Letter cover all services being provided to the client?

fields.name: h
fields.fieldText: h

fields.name: Copy_1_of_Copy_1_of_client_hold_assets
fields.fieldText: Considering the answers to the above should we still be acting for the client?

fields.name: Copy_1_of_Copy_1_of_anonymity
fields.fieldText:
Guidance

 

1.     Cooper Parry procedures require that all client relationships be periodically reviewed to determine whether continuation of the relationship is appropriate. Cooper Parry require this review to be carried out at least annually.

 

2.     Examples of matters which should be considered when making continuation decisions are set out in section a of this checklist. This is not an exhaustive list and there may be other matters which are relevant to the continuation decision.

 

3.     The Money Laundering Regulations 2017 require periodic reassessment of the level of money laundering risk attaching to each client. Please answer the questions to assess the level of risk as either High or Normal. 

 

4.     The Money Laundering Regulations also require periodic review and updating of our “know your client” information. The processes detailed in points above should largely result in this requirement being met but you should consider whether there are any other matters where we need to obtain information or confirmation. If the assessed level of money laundering risk has changed then we need to satisfy ourselves that the client due diligence information which we hold is adequate. If necessary, reference should be made to the Guidance on Client Acceptance and Ongoing Monitoring document which is available on the intranet.

 

5.       Please contact Michelle McDonald or Mike Joy if you have any queries.

ANNUAL ONGOING MONITORING

& ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHECKLIST

fields.name: Client
fields.fieldText: Client:

fields.name: Date_of_original_engagement
fields.fieldText: Date of original engagement

fields.name: Date
fields.fieldText: Date:

fields.name: Client_Code
fields.fieldText: Client Code

fields.name: Sign
fields.fieldText: Sign:

fields.name: General
fields.fieldText:
GENERAL CONTINUATION PROCEDURES

(Please refer to guidance at the end of this document)

fields.name: Comments
fields.fieldText: Comments (Yes or No and additional explanations)

fields.name: checklist
fields.fieldText: Please use this checklist annually for AML purposes and when determining whether to continue with an engagement:

fields.name: a
fields.fieldText: a

fields.name: considered_changes
fields.fieldText:
Have you considered changes that may alter the original assessment of the acceptability of the client and engagement.

Examples of changes that shall cause a careful reconsideration are:

  • Changes in name and/or address;
  • a significant change in the size, structure or nature of the client's business;
  • new sources of finance;
  • a major change in the ownership, management or Trustees of the client;
  • new regulatory reporting requirements: and/or
  • additional service added.

fields.name: b
fields.fieldText: b

fields.name: conducted
fields.fieldText:
Have you conducted conflict checking to determine whether there were any:

  • do we now act for any other family members, close relationships
  • are their any new connections to CP employees

Any such changes will require reconsideration of the firm’s conflict checking procedures

fields.name: c
fields.fieldText: c

fields.name: client_hold_assets
fields.fieldText: Does the client hold assets or undertake activities overseas?

fields.name: links
fields.fieldText: Does the client have links with individuals or businesses in overseas countries with weak money laundering regimes?

fields.name: anonymity
fields.fieldText: Does the client use products, services or entities which provide anonymity?

fields.name: concerns
fields.fieldText: Do we have any concerns over the source of the client’s wealth?

fields.name: funds
fields.fieldText: Do we have any concerns over the source of the client’s funds?

fields.name: anticipate
fields.fieldText: Do we anticipate holding monies for the client?

fields.name: check
fields.fieldText: Check that ‘a’ and ‘b’ are a “Yes” answer and all in ‘c’ are ‘No’ – responses that do not match meet this criteria means the client must be treated as HIGH risk
